tool_description: Send and receive notifications to your WhatsApp, or to whatsapp groups with a shared gateway.
name: whin
title: whin

api_list.name: create group
api_list.description: This endpoint will create a group, it will add you as a member, and will promote you to Admin of the group. Check this [video](https://youtu.be/JrYytFPeRdc) to learn how to use it.
api_list.code:
import requests

url = "https://whin2.p.rapidapi.com/creategroup"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "whin2.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())
api_list.convert_code:
import requests

url = "https://whin2.p.rapidapi.com/creategroup"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "whin2.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())

api_list.name: signup
api_list.description: This endpoint is **ONLY** used to enter the code you received to signup. Read the [tutorial](https://rapidapi.com/inutil-inutil-default/api/whin2/tutorials/what-to-do-to-start-using-whin%3F-1), or follow this [video](https://youtu.be/uOZ-oH4kP58),  to learn how to start using whin.

api_list.name: my groups metadata
api_list.description: This endpoint will return full metadata of your groups, including the one you share with whin.
api_list.code:
import requests

url = "https://whin2.p.rapidapi.com/mygroup"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "whin2.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())

api_list.name: enrol
api_list.description: This endpoint will print a QR code that you need to scan with the whatsapp app on your mobile. Make sure the background of your browser is **NOT** set to dark.
api_list.code:
import requests

url = "https://whin2.p.rapidapi.com/getqr"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "whin2.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())

api_list.name: personal listener
api_list.description:
The response is an url that you have to use as a webhook destination at the origin service. The content sent to it will be routed as a message to a whatsapp group owned by the user, or to the user.
Learn use-cases on these videos: [grafana alerts](https://youtu.be/RvVgg0qwNDk),[Shelly notifications](https://youtu.be/B6MLlBUkyvo), [synology notifications](https://youtu.be/zeAJNuXYqH4).

optional_parameters.name: origin
optional_parameters.description: This is the service that is sending Webhooks to your whin personal receiver. If the origin service is nos listed you can select `Do not include in request`, or leave the value blank, and whin will do its best to parse the payload received.

api_list.name: show url
api_list.description:
This endpoint is used to request the webhook routes created on your account. 
Learn how to use it on this [video](https://youtu.be/8WyG_becZXM)
api_list.code:
import requests

url = "https://whin2.p.rapidapi.com/showurl"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "whin2.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())

api_list.name: websocket checker
api_list.description:
Whin-receive (thick-client) websockets checker. 
This endpoint is **ONLY** used to authorize websocket connections to the backend by thick clients. The Response is a token needed to complete handshaking.
api_list.code:
import requests

url = "https://whin2.p.rapidapi.com/wskchk"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "whin2.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())

api_list.name: hk receiver
api_list.description: this endpoint shall be used by the origin services, it's **NOT** to be used on the playground.

api_list.name: delete url
api_list.description: This endpoint will erase the url you set to receive the whatsapps sent to whin. Learn how to use it on this [video](https://youtu.be/8WyG_becZXM).
api_list.code:
import requests

url = "https://whin2.p.rapidapi.com/delurl"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "whin2.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())
